content: 18 20 & 22 p row 13 decrease k8 skpo k2 k2 decrease k to end - 20sts row 15 decrease skpo k5 skpo k2 k2 decrease k to last 2 sts k2 decrease 16sts row 17 decrease skpo k3 skpo k2 k2 decrease k to last 2 sts k2 decrease 12sts row 19 decrease k3 skpo k2 k2 decrease k to end 10sts row 21 decrease k4 k2 decrease k to end 9sts row 23 kfb k1 skpo k1 k2 decrease k1 kfb row 24 p row 25-28 repeat last 2 row twice row 29 decrease skpo k to last 2 sts k2 decrease 7sts row 30 p row 31-32 repeat last 2 row once 5sts fig 9 lamb page 18 lamb page 19 cut off-white yarns join on yarns a & b brown and beige cont as foll row 13 decrease k2 decrease k1 5 times 5 - 10sts row 33-36 work 4 row st st **** row 14-28 beg with a p row work 15 row st st cast off cut boucle join on yarn a brown cont as foll row 29 decrease k2 skpo k2 k2 decrease k2 8sts right rear leg row 30-32 work 3 row st st **** cast on 4 sts cast off row 1-6 work a left rear leg from * to ** 10sts row 7 k rear legs working on one leg at a time fold the leg in half row 8 increase cast on 10sts for leg back p across all 20 sts matching row ends and mattress sew the seam that runs from cast row 9 increase kfb k7 kfb k2 kfb k to last st kfb 24sts on edge beneath the shaped/ rounded leg top down to the hoof join row 10 p across the cast-off edge at the hoof row 11-36 work a left rear leg from *** to **** 5sts stuff the leg fairly firmly cast off join the straight edge the inside of the leg to the seam backside seam make sure you have the right leg for the right side of the body left for left shaping should be facing forward leg seam towards the forelegs make 2 alike back see fig 10 with yarns b & d beige 4-ply and boucle and larger 3 75mm/ size 5 neatly sew around the open leg top joining it to the rump refer to needles beg at leg top cast on 4 sts row 1 increase kfb k2 kfb 6sts the images for placement it is a little tricky and you may wish to row 2 p pin or tack it in place first row 3 increase kfb k to last st kfb 8sts row 4-5 increase repeat last 2 row once 10sts forelegs working on one leg at a time fold the leg in half row 6-8 work 3 row st st matching row ends and mattress sew across the cast-off edge at the row 9 increase kfb k1 5 times 15sts hoof then join
